Class LegendOverlay

java.lang.Object
  java.awt.Component
      java.awt.Container

                      gov.anl.ipns.ViewTools.Components.Transparency.LegendOverlay
All Implemented Interfaces:
IPreserveState, IOverlay, java.awt.image.ImageObserver, java.awt.MenuContainer, java.io.Serializable, javax.accessibility.Accessible
public class LegendOverlay
extends OverlayJPanel

This class is used by view components to add a legend to a graph.

See Also:
Serialized Form

Field Detail

FONT

public static final java.lang.String FONT
"Font" - This constant String is a key for referencing the state information about the font of the calibrations for this axis overlay. The value that this key references is of type Font.

See Also:

EDITOR_BOUNDS

public static final java.lang.String EDITOR_BOUNDS
"Editor Bounds" - This constant String is a key for referencing the state information about the size and bounds of the Axis Editor window. The value that this key references is a Rectangle. The Rectangle contains the dimensions for the editor.

getObjectState

public ObjectState getObjectState(boolean isDefault)
This method will get the current values of the state variables for this object. These variables will be wrapped in an ObjectState.

Specified by:
getObjectState in interface IPreserveState
Specified by:
getObjectState in class OverlayJPanel
Parameters:
isDefault - Should selective state be returned, that used to store user preferences common from project to project?
Returns:
if true, the default state containing user preferences, if false, the entire state, suitable for project specific saves.

Contains/Displays control information about this overlay.

editLegend

public void editLegend()
This method displays the LegendEditor.

kill

public void kill()
This method is called by to inform the overlay that it is no longer needed. In turn, the overlay closes all windows created by it before closing.

Specified by:
kill in class OverlayJPanel

strokeType

public java.awt.BasicStroke strokeType(int key,
                                       int graph_num)
Makes the different stroke types to be returned

Parameters:
key - the integer constant for the stroke types.
graph_num - the index of the graph. The index must be at least zero and less than the number of graphs currently held in this GraphJPanel. If the graph_num is not valid, this method has no effect and returns false.
Returns:
the stroke type for the particular key.

paint

public void paint(java.awt.Graphics g)
This method will paint the legend. These graphics will overlay onto a jpanel.

Parameters:
g - - graphics object
